text: Chain allows interoperability between different instances e.g. Alice creates asset X in Bank A’s Chain. Bob is a user in Bank B’s Chain. Alice can send pieces of her asset to Bob even though it’s on another Chain. Is this kind of interoperability in the scope for Fabric 1.0?

<@U3P28G5M3> about your errors, can you please tell us about your environment? where are you trying to run "make"? what type of machine+os? To work this will only run natively on linux or MacOS, on other platforms you need to run vagrant (which will set up a virtual linux machine)

<@U2W7U5UA3|pd93> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/pd93/F3RBAPGR5/bluemix_deployment_error.sh|Bluemix Deployment Error> and commented: I've been running Fabric locally for a while now, but today I decided to try Bluemix. I've gone through everything in the host_marbles_bluemix guide to get it running, but I'm getting this error when running `cf push <app>`. The webapp works, but the chaincode fails to deploy. Have I missed something that's not covered here: <https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/marbles/blob/v2.0/docs/host_marbles_bluemix.md>

initial_comment.comment: I've been running Fabric locally for a while now, but today I decided to try Bluemix. I've gone through everything in the host_marbles_bluemix guide to get it running, but I'm getting this error when running `cf push <app>`. The webapp works, but the chaincode fails to deploy. Have I missed something that's not covered here: <https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/marbles/blob/v2.0/docs/host_marbles_bluemix.md>

text: Does Fabric uses UTXO or something else?
Has anybody installed fabric  using docker swarm ?  if yes please share  docs or any relevant info :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U3B2F5VC0> if you got,then plz share with me too
<@U3B2F5VC0> What exactly are you trying with docker-swarm -- ?
